Questions.Question: According to the lesson, what is the 'golden rule' of migration?
Options: Migrate everything at once for consistency
Always start with the database layer
Rewrite tests after the migration is complete
Questions.Explanation: The lesson states: 'Never stop shipping. A migration that blocks feature development is a migration that will be cancelled.'

Questions.Question: What is the Strangler Fig pattern according to the lesson?
Options: A pattern for removing dead code
A gradual replacement strategy where old and new systems coexist
A testing pattern for legacy code
Questions.Explanation: The lesson explains the Strangler Fig pattern as gradually replacing parts of the system, running old and new in parallel, and cutting over incrementally.

Questions.Question: According to the lesson, what is the first and most important step when migrating to Hexagonal Architecture?
Options: Extract business logic into a clean domain layer
Questions.Explanation: The lesson states in the 'Extracting the Domain' section: 'The first and most important step: pull business logic out of handlers and infrastructure into a clean domain layer.'
